medical_history.chief_complaint: Infiltrating ductal carcinoma of the right breast.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient became aware of a crease in the upper outer portion of the right breast 2 months before admission, initially thinking it was due to a blocked milk duct while breast-feeding. Three weeks prior to evaluation, a mass was palpated during a routine gynecological exam. Imaging studies revealed a heterogeneous spiculated mass in the right breast and additional abnormalities suggesting malignancy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of endometriosis, idiopathic thrombocytopenia during first pregnancy, and multiple orthopedic procedures. Medications include carbamazepine, calcium, and vitamins.
medical_history.family_history: Three maternal relatives had breast cancer; a maternal second cousin in her 40s and two maternal great-aunts (one in her 60s). Paternal grandfather had lung cancer at age 85 and paternal grandmother had colon cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with her husband and children, drinks alcohol in moderation, and does not smoke. No occupation outside the home.
